intro: Adenia letouzeyi, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-colored berry that contains several seeds. Adenia letouzeyi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
